Learning Markdown

While I enjoy marking up text with HTML, it is in my interest to learn, and master, markdown. This post is a little playpen for me to learn and document learning markdowns.

Let’s start with some basics

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 4

Heading 5

Text Basics

Now for a paragraph of text. I have written a few sentences of text. This is on a new line in my text editor, but it should be in the same paragraph.

Text separated by an empty lines start a new paragraph.

An unordered list:

  • item
  • item
  • item

Ordered list:

  1. item
  2. item
  3. item

And a nested list:

  1. item
    • sub-item
    • sub-item
      1. sub-sub-item
      2. sub-sub-item
    • sub-item
  2. item

italic text

bold text

~~strikethrough~~

‘as is text s p a c i n g’
